meanings.definition: To curve upward in the middle.
meanings.sent1: The road was cambering gently, making the drive smoother.
meanings.sent2: The skier was cambering down the slope with ease.
meanings.sent3: The cat was cambering up the tree, pretending to be a skilled climber.
meanings.sent4: Her smile cambered up, brightening the room instantly.
meanings.sent5: The kite was cambering gracefully in the sky, dancing with the wind.

meanings.definition: The slight upward curve of a surface.
meanings.sent1: The cambering of the bridge helped with water drainage.
meanings.sent2: The cambering of the hill provided a beautiful view of the valley.
meanings.sent3: The cambering of the cake made it look like a delicious wave.
meanings.sent4: The cambering of the roof resembled a gentle arch against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The cambering of the road guided the rainwater to the sides, preventing flooding.
